body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install m4
```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

```
$ spack/bin/spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.0
* **Python:** 3.4.3
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu14.04-broadwell
* **Concretizer:** original

$ cat packages.yaml 
packages:
  all:
    compiler: [gcc@8.4.0]
```

### Additional information

I wonder if this might be related to #10493.  Possibly, like that issue, my spack is on an NAS filesystem. (The staging dir, on `/tmp`, is local, however.)  Like that issue, the traceback upon keyboard interrupt shows that Spack was stuck in `log.py`:

```console
==> Installing m4-1.4.18-vlt4klqmalwgnszby63obyudnhfrop3e
==> No binary for m4-1.4.18-vlt4klqmalwgnszby63obyudnhfrop3e found: installing from source
==> Fetching https://spack-llnl-mirror.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/_source-cache/archive/ab/ab2633921a5cd38e48797bf5521ad259bdc4b979078034a3b790d7fec5493fab.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Fetching https://spack-llnl-mirror.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/_source-cache/archive/fc/fc9b61654a3ba1a8d6cd78ce087e7c96366c290bc8d2c299f09828d793b853c8
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> m4: Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> m4: Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Error: Exception occurred in writer daemon!
Traceback (most recent call last):
==> Error: Failed to install m4 due to KeyboardInterrupt: 
  File "/foobar/home/osolberg/spack3/spacktree/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/tty/log.py", line 763, in _writer_daemon
    line = _retry(in_pipe.readline)()
  File "/foobar/home/osolberg/spack3/spacktree/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/tty/log.py", line 825, in wrapped
    return function(*args, **kwargs)
KeyboardInterrupt

==> Error: Keyboard interrupt.
```

It will hang at `==> m4: Executing phase: 'configure'` for hours, days, as long as I let it.

After killing, if I retry again, it might or might not work.  Seems to hang about 50% of the time.

If I do a `spack build-env m4 bash` and cd to the staging/src dir, and then do a `./configure` -- it succeeds **every** time, and only takes about 45 seconds.

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [X] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [ ] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers  **(I have not, b/c I don't think this is an issue with the package build, per se)**
- [ ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files **(ibid, and also b/c there are path names I would have to obfuscate)**
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate

FYI @hartzell
title: install of m4 hangs during configure
